name: Saint Patrick's Soup
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: This soup is the perfect way to transform the last of that corned beef into something different, yet still the same. I purposely set some aside just to make this soup. Feel free to sub beef broth for the vegetable broth but just know it will alter the color of the finished soup tremendously making it not as appealing to the eyes.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat
Add onions and cook for 3 minutes
Add celery, carrots, and garlic, and cook for 5 minutes more
Stir in potatoes, broth, beer, and mustard, and bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes
Stir in cabbage and cook for 5 minutes
Turn heat off and stir in corned beef
Ladle into bowls and season with salt and pepper
